swedish.text: He who sleeps does not sin.
Charity supports both the giver and the receiver
Shared joy is double joy; shared sorrow is half a sorrow.
The afternoon knows what the morning never suspected.
In a small house God has His corner, in a big house He has to stand in the hall.
A house that is built according to every man's advice seldom gets a roof.
The bird on the wing finds something, the sitting bird nothing.
Children act in the village as they have learned at home.
Beauty without grace is a rose without scent.
Don't get scaled by the gruel of another.
Don't judge the dog from its hairs.
Don't let your sorrow come higher than your knees.
Don't look a horse that was given to you in the mouth.
Don't scald your lips on another's soup.
Don't sell the fur until the bear has been shot.
Don't sit among scoffers.
Don't think about the pig until it's in the poke.
Don't throw away the old bucket until you know whether the new one holds water.
Don't throw out the child with the bathwater.
Being serious and having a good time thrive together.
Being young is a fault which improves daily.
Best to bend while it is a twig.
Better late than never.
swedish.description: It’s best to do something on time. But if you can’t do it on time, do it late.

swedish.text: Better to be a poor woman than the slave of the rich.
Better to dam the brook than the creek.
Big in the words, small on the ground.
Big processes make well dressed lawyers and naked parties.
Burned child avoids the fire.
Business is business.
An upstanding peasant is bigger than a nobleman on his knees.
Angry cats get scratched skin.
Another's damage is soon forgotten.
Anyone can tame a shrew but he who has her.
As the master sleeps, the servant dreams.
As the question so the answer.
Away is good but at home is best.
Bare is a brotherless behind.
Behind the mountain are people too.
Behind the mountain there are people too.
A hundred tailors, a hundred millers, and a hundred weavers make three hundred thieves.
A lazy thief is better than a lazy servant.
A life without love is like a year without summer.
A man without money is like a boat without sails.
A nice face is the best letter of recommendation.
A peacock has too little in its head and too much in its tail.
A piece of bread in the pocket is better than a feather in the hat.
A piece of bread in your pocket is better than a feather in your hat.
A quarrel between brothers costs soul and life.
A soft answer calms the wrath.
Butterflies forget that they were once caterpillars.
By being in front everywhere one may get a telling-off.
Charity does not lessen you, going to church does not hinder you.
Charity supports both the giver and receiver.
Childhood memories last long.
Children travel from the heart to the heart.
Children's bread is hard to chew.
Choose your bedfellows by day.
Daringly dared, half of it won.
Don't throw pearls to the swine.
Don't wake the bear that sleeps.
Don't weep over spilled milk.
Eaten bread is soon forgotten.
Empty barrels are the noisiest.
Empty barrels make the most noise.
Envy is the companion of great success.
Envy is the truest form of flattery.
Even a blind dove finds a grain of wheat at times.
Even after the accusation or rumour has been refuted, a suspicion nonetheless lingers.
A stern creditor is a poor payer.
A successful writer has a good memory and hopes that others do not have it.
A tiny one seems arrogant.
A woman is the last judgement of the man.
Advice should be viewed from behind.
After the rain the grass will grow; after wine, conversation.
Alder fences don't last more than a year.
Alike children play the best.
All are children.
All are not men that wear trousers.
Who builds something, had better count two dollars for one.
Who cannot pray to God, let him go to sea.
Who digs many wells doesn't get sweet water in all of them.
Who does not want to work in the heat, will have to starve in the cold.
Who has much, he gets even more.
Who has once deceived will ever be a suspect.
Who is chasing after another must himself rest.
Who is everywhere is nowhere.
Who is in front everywhere often gets a nose-burn.
Who is insulted for a long time, finally loses his patience.
Praise gets closer than blame.
Praise is easier got than kept.
Praise makes the good man better, blame makes the bad one worse.
Pray and work.
Premature purchase is repented.
Prepaid work is slow.
Pride goes before fall.
Promise freely, fullfill sparingly.
Quickly dear and soon forgotten.
Rather one bird in the hand, than ten in the woods.
Out of the ashes into the fire.
Over-praise is a burden.
Paid work progresses slowly.
Pay back with the same coin.
Peculiar people may show up anywhere.
Persevere and never fear.
Pitch and tar are the navy seaman's pride.
Poor material yields poor results.
Poverty and love are difficult to hide.
Practice gives skill.
A bad reputation is seldom completely amiss.
A bashful dog rarely gets fat.
A bee does not touch a withered flower.
A bird in the hand is worth more than ten in the bush.
A brother's wrath is a devil's wrath.
A business is good, when both parties make a good bargain.
A child is a certain sorrow and uncertain joy.
A fly doesn't harm anyone.
A hard-working man is worth more than a crowd of loafers.
A hardworking man is better than a crowd of loafers.
One is also to let the other party be heard.
One kisses the child and means the nurse.
One should choose one's bedfellow whilst it is daylight.
One should go invited to a friend in good fortune, and uninvited in misfortune.
One should go out of the way for little children and drunks.
One talks against praise in order to hear it once again
One time is no time - two times is a habit.
Only child, dear child.
Other times, other customs.
Other years other hairs.
We have all been children.
We know others by ourselves, sid the loafer about the lice.
We note the faults of others and forget our own.
We notice faults of others and easily forget our own.
We praise in order to be praised in return.
We should build with the stones we have.
We should not burn the light in both ends.
Weeds last the season.
What breaks in a moment may take years to mend.
What can you expect from a pig but a grunt?.
Fear less, hope more;Whine less, breathe more;Talk less, say more;Hate less, love more;And all good things are yours.
Fear less, hope more; eat less, chew more; whine less, breathe more; talk less, say more; hate less, love more; and all good things are yours.
Fear less, hope more; whine less, breath more; talk less, say more; Hate less, love more; and all good things are yours.
Fear may force a man to cast beyond the moon.
Float on small clouds.
Fools and stubborn people make rich lawyers.
For lack of hens the fox catches crows.
For the lack one thing, take another, whether better or worse.
Friendship doubles our joy and divides our grief.
From children and fools we may hear the truth.
Recognize gladly great exploits, but wait a while first.
Reflect on beforehand.
Self-praise smells bad.
Seriousness and mildness ought to work in unison.
Seriousness and pleasure should thrive together.
Shared joy is a double joy; shared sorrow is half a sorrow.
Shared joy is double joy and shared sorrow is half-sorrow.
Shared joy is double joy. Shared sorrow is half sorrow.
Shoemaker, stick to your last.
Shoot the bear before you skin it.
There's no hurry, said the shoemaker, he had gruel with his awl.
They who want to sing will always find a song.
Those who want to share the gains, shall also share the losses.
Those who wish to shine always find a song.
Those who wish to sing always find a song.
Thou are a bitter bird, said the raven to the starling.
Thou hast a head and so hath a pin.
Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn.
To buy the pig in the bag.
To dance according to someones pipe.
Slander makes friends part.
Slowly but surely.
Small pots also have ears.
Small tuft often overturns a big load.
Small wells are soon drained.
Sour said the fox about rowanberries.
Strike while the iron is hot.
Sweep first before your own door, before you sweep the doorsteps of your neighbors.
Take the custom where you come.
Take with you an onion to the funeral.
Have a fire for the crows.
He gets a tailwind who bothers to wait.
He laughs best who laughs last.
He who builds and he who marries are never safe.
He who cannot keep silence cannot speak.
He who digs a pit for someone else, often falls into it himself.
He who fears every bush, comes late to the wood.
He who has long fingers should also have long legs.
He who laughs the last, laughs the best.
Here there will be different buns, said the baker, he "sat down" on the bread shovel.
Many buy the bearskin before the bear is shot.
Many caress the child for the sake of the wet nurse.
Many children and little food make thin smoerbroeds.
Many small brooks will form a big river.
Many who kiss the child mean the nurse.
Measure twice, cut once.
Midsummer night is not long but it sets many cradles rocking.
Morning hour has gold in its mouth.
No letters are good letters.
No news is good news.
Even the sun has got spots.
Evening song with drinks: morning song with coughs.
Everything comes round.
Evil gun powder doesn't go away easily.
Eyes that do not cry, do not see.
Fact is stranger than fiction.
Faith can move mountains.
Farmers are people too.
Fear less, hope more,Whine less, breathe more,Talk less, say more,Hate less, love more,And all good things are yours.
Fear less, hope more, eat less, chew more, whine less, breathe more, talk less, say more, hate less, love more, and all good things will be yours.
When the cat's away, the rats dance on the table.
When the child is weaned, they say goodbye to the nurse.
When the child is weened, the nurse is fired.
When the sea is calm, every ship has a good captain.
When the well is dry, we know what it's worth.
When we all do as we please, all the food is eaten and all the girls will be maiden.
When you're speaking about the trolls, they're standing in the entrance hall listening.
Where all limp, everybody thinks he walks straight.
Where are breads in the desert?
Where poverty comes in, love goes out.
What can't be alter'd must be borne, not blamed.
What doesn't kill, hardens.
What is well-known only seems to be testified.
What matter if I suffer, if only my neighbor suffers too.
What was bought in a hurry may soon be regretted.
What you don't know doesn't hurt you.
When a lawyer dies, the Devil follows him to his grave.
When the blind man carries the lame man, both go forward.
When the blind one carries the lame one, both of them gets ahead.
When the businessmen sleep, the ad works.
If you have said a, you have to say b.
If you lose one, there are a thousand more to choose from.
If you marry money the devil lays an egg in your storeroom.
If you want to look good, you have to suffer.
In a good book the best is between the lines.
In a small house God has His corner; in a big house, He has to stand in the hall.
In calm water every ship has a good captain.
In distress there is no law.
In spring no one thinks of the snow that fell last year.
In the shallowest waters, the ugliest fish swim.
From children old people arise.
From damage one may get wiser.
Give a servant a proper meal and the cow will give more milk and the cat will drink less.
Give equal in reply, answer according to the call.
Give the white child so that the black child doesn't cry.
God gives every bird a worm, but he does not throw it into the nest.
God gives every bird his worm, but he does not throw it into the nest.
Good day, axe-handles.
Grasp all, lose all.
Hard bread does the cheek red.
That our hands show signs of our work, is nothing to be ashamed of.
That was on the hair.
The appetite grows while one eats;.
The bearskin does not bite.
The bee has a sting but honey too.
The bee without a sting collects no honey.
The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.
The burnt child shuns the fire.
The butterfly often forgets it was a caterpillar.
All are not virgins that carry wreaths.
All cannot have the Bishop for uncle.
All days' evening is not come.
All fools are brothers.
All is not for all.
All roads lead to Rome.
All that glitters is not gold.
Alms do not decrease, going to church does not hinder.
Amen, said the minister, he hit the old lady in the head with the New Testament.
An accident rarely comes alone.
Death is God's broom.
Death is the last doctor.
Devils have more than twelve apostles.
Do not hang the bread basket too high.
Do not judge all you see, do not believe all you hear, do not do all you can, do not say all you know, do not eat all you have, let no one know what you have in your heart or in your wallet.
Do not wake up the sleeping bear.
Don't build bigger houses than you may set roofs on.
Don't celebrate until you are across the brook.
Don't cross the brook for water.
Don't cross the stream to find water.
Who proves too much proves ingenting.
Who sits on your shoulders will try to climb on your head.
Who waits for a heritage may have to wait long.
Who wants to have something good, will have to seek it where it is.
Who winks to the blind, does work in vain.
Wisdom is in the head and not in the beard.
Work is half of health.
Work sweetens the sleep.
Worry gives a small thing a big shadow.
Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow.
It's no good to sprick the bear with a needle.
It's not one person's fault if two people quarrel.
It's not the fault of one, that two are fighting.
It's the thought that counts.
Keep several balls in the air.
Lack of bread forces one to work.
Lawyers and soldiers are the Devil's playmates.
Lend to God and the earth -- they both pay good interest.
Let the other party be heard too.
Lick upwards, kick downwards.
The more chefs, the better the soup.
The old have the calendar in their bodies.
The older buck gets, the harder become its horns.
The perch has a good time, it drinks when it wants to.
The poor man has none to envy him.
The poorest payer is the best collector of his own credits.
The public is an animal with many heads.
The ring of gold is never so red that it is not dispensed with for breads.
The stomack is filled earlier than the eye.
The strongest among the disabled is the one who never forgets his disability.
The farmer should be mightier than his land.
The faults of others are the best teachers.
The faults of others make no law.
The first at the mill can grind the first.
The grass is always greener on the other side of the fence.
The is unnecessary to make a fuss of any sort of thrash.
The joke is the weapon of the witty; being serious is the shield of the stupid.
The master has long arms, but they don't reach heaven.
The miser is his own mother-in-law.
The modest one gets nothing.
Like master like dog.
Long vouched for is not donated.
Lots of winter, lots of summer.
Love has produced some heroes but even more idiots.
Love is like dew that falls on both nettles and lilies.
Love me when I least deserve it, because that's when I really need it.
Lovely flowers fade fast.
Luck never gives; it only lends.
Manure and diligence makes the farmer rich.
Many a mickle makes a muckle.
Worrying never did anyone any good.
You can't teach old dogs to sit.
You cannot ask more of an ox than a steak.
You cannot prevent the birds of sadness from passing over your head, but you can prevent them from nesting in your hair.
You don't know what may happen before evening.
You don't miss the cow until the stall is empty.
You must take the chance to forge whilst the iron is hot.
You never wait too long, when you wait for something good.
You should not paint the devil on the wall.
You shouldn't saw off the branch you're sitting on.
No smoke without a fire.
Nobility follows the man's line at a wedding.
Noble deeds are done in silence.
Not all who fold their hands, are praying.
Not everything that glimmers is gold.
Nothing beneath the sun is lasting.
Nothing stimulates the appetite like little on the plate.
Now the fairytale is over.
Old men carry the almanac in their bones.
One does not accept praise from anybody.
The child is the father of the man.
The child's bottom and April weather arre not to be trusted.
The cow of another has always a bigger udder.
The cure for anything is salt water - sweat, tears, or the sea.
The damage of another is soon forgotten.
The day we fear hastens toward us, the day we long for creeps.
The death of one - the bread of the other.
The deepest well can also be drained.
The dogs in Lund bark.
The end is good, everything is good.
The tables are turned.
The wails of heirs are halfway laughter.
The waiting man gets the wind behind him.
The way you make your bed, that's how you'll lie down.
The well-bred child chastizes itself.
The young should be taught, the old should be honored.
There are more motley dogs than the priest's.
There is no bad weather only bad clothing.
There is seldom cattle without some motley animals.
There would be no slanderers if none would listen to them.
To get may rest on luck, to keep may rest on virtue.
To have a lot of irons in the fire.
To praise is to assess.
To speak is silver, to keep silent is gold.
To step in the harmonica.
To the one who waits comes the tailwind at last.
Undeserved curses don't bite a lot.
Walk like the cat around hot porridge.
We are esteemed and treated by the company we keep.
We get tired of doing nothing.
Hit like a bomb.
Hit two flies with one smack.
How long was Adam in Paradise?
Hurry slowly.
I suspected this might happen, said the one that was kicked out.
If a blind man leads another, they both fall together.
If it weren't for my need to fill my belly, I would have gilded my arm.
If we reject the chaff, we may easily lose the kernel.
If you are among the roses, your friends will look for you among the thorns.
If you buy what you don't need, you steal from yourself.
It goes off as when the blind fight.
It has to be fixed one way or another.
It is seldom the fault of one when two argue.
It is the crime that causes the shame, and not the punishment.
It is well to learn from the errors of others, since there is not time enough to make all of them by yourself.
It will always be rotten for me, said the farmer when they ran out of sacrament wine precisely when he wanted to go forward.
It will once come to pass as the old goose quacked.
It's always something said the girl with a nosebleed.
It's an easy burden that another carries.
It's good to learn from the errors of others, since we don't have time to carry out all of them ourselves.
Worry gives a small thing a big shadow
Bare is a brotherless behind
A quarrel between brothers costs soul and life
Fear less, hope more; Eat less, chew more; Whine less, breathe more; Talk less, say more; Love more, and all good things will be yours!
In a good book the best is between the lines
Love me when I least deserve it, because that’s when I really need it
Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow
It is more blissful to give than to receive.
Don’t cross the stream to find water.
Don’t throw away an old bucket until you know the new one holds water.
Those who want to sing will always find a song.
If you buy what you don’t need, you steal from yourself.
Don’t let your sorrow come higher than your knees.
Fear less, hope more, eat less, chew more, whine less, berathe more, talk less, say more, hate less, love more, and all good things will be yours.
Fear less, hope more; eat less, chew more; whine less, breathe more; talk less, say more; hate less, love more; and all good things will be yours.
Those who wish to sing, always find a song.
The master has long arms, but they don’t reach heaven.
Lend to God and the earth — they both pay good interest.
Talk less, say more; hate less, love more; and all good things are yours.
The devil visits the rich too — but he visits the poor twice.
When a blind man carries a lame man, both go forward.
Don’t throw away the old bucket until you know whether the new one holds water.
Nobody is too young to die tomorrow.
A woman is the last judgment of the man.
Hunger is the best seasoning.
Death is the last doctor.
Death is God’s broom.
It is seldom the fault of one when two argue.
A child is a certain sorrow and uncertain joy.
The liar will only be trusted once.
Do not throw the baby out with the bathwater.
Do not cross the brook for water.
To lazy pigs the ground is always frozen.
The closer to the source, the clearer the water.
One cannot both eat one’s cookie and keep it.
It is easy to cut broad strips off other people’s leather.
Don’t buy the pig in the bag.
New brooms sweep the best.
Rather an honest ‘no’ than an insincere ‘yes’.
Away is good but home is best.
It is darkest before dawn.
When a blind man carries the lame man, both go forward.
Old is oldest.
Best to learn from other people’s injury.
Forbidden road is often heavily worn.
Opportunity makes the thief.
A journey of a thousand miles always begins with a single step.
The way the devil reads the bible.
As you shout you get will be answered.
Such father, such son.
Sin punishes itself.
Don’t celebrate until you have crossed the creek.
Money cannot buy happiness.
An ounce of lying saves tons of explanations.
Better listen to a broken string than never having bent a bow.
From children, drunkards and madmen you get to hear the truth.
Don’t shoot yourself in the foot.
That day, that sorrow.
A good man manages on his own.
Warned is armed.
The smith’s horse and the shoemakers children are worst shod.
Each person is the forger of his own happiness.
Don’t think about the pig until it’s in the poke.
No one is a prophet in one’s own homeland.
To err is human; to forgive, divine.
Constant sunshine makes a desert.
As old people sing, young people tweet.
There must be some moderation.
Each thing has its time.
What starts with a needle usually ends with a silver bowl.
When the devil grows old he turns religious.
He who whispers lies.
Self is the best farmhand.
Envy never rests.
What is unclearly said is unclearly thought.
Alone is strong.
Every cloud has a silver lining.
swedish.description: People say this when things are going badly or when someone is sad. Clouds stand for bad situations. Every bad situation has some good parts to it—you just have to look for them. The proverb is meant to help people feel better and keep going. It’s also where the name of the movie “Silver Linings Playbook” came from.

swedish.text: Hunger is the best flavouring.
It is never too late.
Old love never rusts.
Better breadless than clueless.
No one is indispensable.
What you lose at the swings you take back at the merry-go-round.
What is hidden in snow is revealed at thaw.
To separate is to die a little.
Whichever way you turn you have your end in the back.
He who waits for something good never waits too long.
Health is quietly keeping silent .
Close does not shoot any hares.
It is better to free someone guilty than to convict someone innocent.
Clothing makes the man.
Best to be without oaths.
The death of one, the bread of the other.
Don’t put stones on a burden.
It is not one person’s fault if two people quarrel.
If you say ‘A’ you have to say ‘B’.
Taste is like the buttocks, divided.
The stomach gets full before the eye.
No party without shattering.
One time, no time — two times, a habit.
Burnt child shuns fire.
The later in the evening, the more beautiful the people.
Small pots have ears too.
He who lives shall see.
A place for each thing and each thing in its place
Tis better to have loved and lost than to have never loved at all.
What one’s head lacks one has to have in one’s legs.
A poor craftsman blames his tools.
Poor memory is better than bad memories.
It is fairer to listen to the string that broke than to never strain a bow.
Revenge is sweet.
Even a blind hen can find a grain.
The grass is always greener on the other side.
swedish.description: ‘The grass is always greener” is a proverb that teaches us it’s not good to be jealous (to want what other people have). It may seem like everyone around you has “greener grass,” meaning nicer cars, better jobs, etc.

swedish.text: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
swedish.description: To be successful in life you need to settle down in one place and stop moving all the time. It also means that an active busy person will never stagnate and should prove to be productive and creative.

swedish.text: Laid card lies.
Hope is the last thing to leave a human being.
Ingratitude is the world’s reward.
One learns from mistakes.
Where there is modesty there is virtue.
The drunken man’s words is the sober man’s thoughts.
Insight is more valuable than gold.
Don’t light a fire for the crows.
Much wants more.
You should not judge a dog by its fur.
Everyone knows the monkey, but the monkey knows no one.
You can’t teach old dogs to sit.
Two wrongs do not make a right.
No trees grow to the sky.
Reality surpasses the poem.
If it tastes good it is expensive.
Happiness comes happiness leaves.
He who always knows best never learns.
Even a fool when he holdeth his peace is counted wise.
Speak with farmers like farmers speak, and with the educated in latin.
Stinginess deceives wisdom.
Politicians are like crocodiles — big jaws but no ears.
A chain is no stronger than its weakest link.
You should forge while the iron is hot.
swedish.description: This old expression comes from the days of blacksmiths (people who work with metal). To shape the metal, the blacksmith would have to beat it with a hammer. Iron is easier to work with when it’s hot. This proverb means you should take advantage of the moment. If an opportunity presents itself to you, take it! Take action because the chance may not come again.

swedish.text: Appearances deceive.
Money does not grow on trees.
The most important thing is not to win, but to fight well.
Don’t let grass grow on your feet.
Easier said than done.
We all start out as children.
All is fair in love and war.
Empty barrels are noisiest.
Don’t sell the fur until the bear has been shot.
The exception confirms the rule.
Cookie searches for a wife.
Children do as you do, not as you say.
Joy and sorrow are next door neighbors.
The more chefs, the worse the soup.
Money opens all gates but heaven’s.
Don’t set about mountains when there are pebbles.
To dare is to lose your foothold for a moment, to not dare is to lose yourself.
One learns as long as one lives.
Easily caught, easily lost.
Where wine enters sense leaves.
As one is dressed one will be judged.
Love is blind.
swedish.description: If you love someone, you don’t notice his or her faults. You think they’re perfect.

swedish.text: Honor whom should be honored.
One should not offer cinnamon rolls to baker’s children.
If the head is dumb, the body suffers.
Gold blinds many, love blinds all.
Of what fills the heart speaks the mouth.
Better to keep quiet than to speak poorly .
You are always closest to yourself.
When distress is the greatest, help is the nearest.
When you’re speaking about the trolls, they’re standing in the entrance hall listening.
Nothing is so good that it can’t be made better.
The sun also has its spots.
It is easy to be prudent in hindsight.
Let him who is without sin cast the first stone.
One swallow does not a summer make.
In the realm of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.
Injury makes you wise.
The walls have ears.
If a blind one leads another, they both fall together.
A friend’s slap has honest intentions, your enemies’ kisses are meant to deceive.
The eyes want more than the stomach.
Quick wealth makes the man suspicious.
Don’t sell the pelt until you’ve killed the bear.
The water you collect from the stream teaches you about its source.
One must take matters into one’s own hands.
During the evening the lazy get in a hurry.
It is to be bent in time, that which bent shall be.
Time heals all wounds.
Even the best can make mistakes.
Better loved and lost than never loved.
One should eat or one dies.
A small tuft often overturns a big load.
Death is God’s broom.
No smoke without fire.
A hearty laugh lengthens your life.
A clenched fist can neither give nor take.
Easier hides a wise man his wisdom than a fool his madness.
Attack is the best defense.
To defend a wrong, is to wrong do anew.
All good things are three.
Necessity is the mother of invention.
swedish.description: There are situations in life when we can’t get the things we may need. It is often at these moments when we invent something to solve our problem, which is why necessity is the mother of invention.

swedish.text: All aren’t gold that glimmers.
Forbidden fruit always tastes the best.
What you do not know does not hurt you.
He who enters the game must endure it.
In a small house God has his corner, in a large house He has to stand in the hall.
Own praise has a bad smell.
All eggs should not be put in one basket.
Even a small star shines in the darkness.
Those are wise that heed advice, but no one should heed dissuasive advice.
First to the mill will first grind.
Do not wake the bear that sleeps.
Evil shall by evil be expelled.
Sleeping farmer gets a dreaming farmhand.
A beloved child has many names.
Each bird sings according to its own beak.
Better to flee than to fence poorly.
One shouldn’t buy a pig in a sack.
‘If it isn’t one thing it’s the other’ said the girl with a nosebleed.
In the desert sand is cheap.
Don’t waste gunpowder on dead crows.
When God brings death, the devil brings heirs.
Where shall the ladle be if not in the cauldron?
You never get tired of working for yourself.
Money does not smell.
Grab the bull by its horns.
Shame on he who gives up.
He who bids for much, often loses all.
All methods are good except for the bad ones.
The truth comes forward in wine.
Expect nothing from friends, do what you can do yourself.
Do not pull everyone over with a comb.
Wisdom has long ears and short tongue.
Things never turn out the way you imagined.
If there is room in the heart, there is room for the behind.
Thin mosquitoes bite the worse.
As you sow, so shall you reap.
swedish.description: You have to accept the consequences of your actions.

swedish.text: Adversity exists to be overcome.
While there is life there is hope.
A woman is the last judge of the man.
It will be like it will be.
He who digs a pit for others, often falls into it himself.
The pillow is the best adviser.
Don’t wake a sleeping bear.
Afterwards is no advice.
Comes time comes counsel.
Rome was not built in one day.
Fortune favours the bold.
Don’t look a gift horse in the mouth.
Each smith has his custom.
Love me when I least deserve it, because that is when I need it the most.
The apple does not fall far from the tree.
Blood is thicker than water.
swedish.description: This proverb essentially means that family ties are stronger than any other type, using blood as the literal term for a relative (as in you share the same DNA.) A good example of when to use this would be if a family member and a close friend had a disagreement, you might decide that despite being impartial in the argument, you are going to take the side of the family member because ‘blood is thicker than water.’

swedish.text: Through yourself you know others.
Dig where you stand.
Do not make a hen out of a feather.
The way to a man’s heart is through his stomach.
When it rains on the priest, it dripples on the sacristan.
It concerns you, too, when your neighbor’s wall is on fire.
Own hearth is gold worth.
Eye for an eye, tooth for a tooth.
Honesty lasts the longest.
Slow but steady.
The end justifies the means.
Time passes by quickly when you are enjoying yourself.
‘Sour’ said the fox about rowanberries.
The loss on the swings is won back on the merry-go-round.
A spoken word and a thrown stone cannot be called back.
Distress knows no law.
Do not weep over spilled milk.
Variety delights.
Dear child has many names.
Only Sweden has Swedish gooseberries.
Each day has enough of its own misery.
When the mouse is full, the flour tastes bitter.
You must learn to crawl before you can walk.
It is best to bite into the sour apple
Nothing is new under the sun.
Shortcuts are often ’longcuts’.
A clean conscience is the best pillow.
One should not add oil to the fire.
The road to hell is lined with good resolutions.
Patience is the art of hoping.
The donkey is known by his ears, the fool by his words.
Don’t praise the day before the sun has set.
In the calmest waters swim the ugliest fish.
Let the food silence the mouth.
When it rains manna from heaven, the poor one does not have a spoon.
What doesn’t kill, hardens.
Evil gun powder doesn’t go away easily.
Treat others as you would want to be treated yourself.
If you give someone a finger he wants the whole hand.
As you make your bed, so will you sleep.
Don’t saw off the branch you’re sitting on.
It’s the thought that counts.
You have to correct your mouth according to your lunch pack.
In darkness all cats are grey.
After rain comes sunshine.
One should not change horses in the middle of the stream.
When the cat is away, the rats dance on the table.
The nail that sticks out gets struck.
One should not bow before stupidity merely because it is old.
Small wounds and poor friends should not be despised.
It’s a small world.
swedish.description: You usually say it to someone you know when you meet him/her very far away from home.

swedish.text: Self-praise stinks.
The dripping can hollow the stone.
You don’t miss the cow until the stall is empty.
He who saves, has.
He who buys what he does not need, steals from himself.
swedish.description: A person should spend only on essential or necessary items and avoid frivolous expenses.
